pageTitle: Prime Minister Trudeau speaks with the President Hollande of France | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke today with the President of France, François Hollande. 

President Hollande offered his condolences for the tragic shooting at the Centre culturel islamique de Québec in the Ste-Foy neighbourhood of Québec City.  Prime Minister Trudeau conveyed his solidarity with France following the attack at the Louvre Museum in Paris on February 3.

The two leaders discussed the importance of promoting inclusion and diversity to counter all forms of radicalization, and agreed to continue working together in the fight against extremism.
